block.p: Sara Marjorie Morse, a daughter of Carol and David Morse of Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., was married yesterday to Thomas John Frankie, a son of Geraldine and Thomas D. Frankie of Valley Stream, N.Y. Steven P. Grant, a village justice in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., officiated at Reid Castle at Manhattanville College in Purchase, N.Y.

Mrs. Frankie, 29, is a doctoral candidate in clinical psychology at the Massachusetts School of Professional Psychology in Boston. She graduated from Cornell and received a master's in education from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father is the president of the APM Hexseal Corporation, which makes electrical sealing products in Englewood, N.J. Her mother retired as a physical therapist in Dobbs Ferry.

Sara Marjorie Morse, a daughter of Carol and David Morse of Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., was married yesterday to Thomas John Frankie, a son of Geraldine and Thomas D. Frankie of Valley Stream, N.Y. Steven P. Grant, a village justice in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., officiated at Reid Castle at Manhattanville College in Purchase, N.Y.

Mrs. Frankie, 29, is a doctoral candidate in clinical psychology at the Massachusetts School of Professional Psychology in Boston. She graduated from Cornell and received a master's in education from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father is the president of the APM Hexseal Corporation, which makes electrical sealing products in Englewood, N.J. Her mother retired as a physical therapist in Dobbs Ferry.

Mr. Frankie, 32, is a conservation education specialist at the Buttonwood Park Zoo in New Bedford, Mass. Until August 2003 he was as an instructor at the Bronx Zoo. He graduated from Fordham, where he also received a master's in education. His mother is the office manager for a medical practice in Elmont, N.Y. His father retired as a field engineer in Valley Stream, laying out buildings to architectural specifications.
